item.title: Dumbledore What to Expect From Robert Mueller's Wednesday Hearings
item.description: Robert Mueller is set to testify on Wednesday in front of the House Judiciary Committee.
item.content:encoded:
Former special counsel Robert Mueller will testify for the first time on Wednesday about his investigation into Russian interference during the 2016 presidential election.

The hearing will begin at 8:30 a.m. EST. Listen to Mueller's live testimony here.

Mueller will testify to Congress, answering questions about the four-month-old investigation, bringing it back into the public eye.

The Justice Department instructed Mueller not to stray past his report's findings. Associate Deputy Attorney General Bradley Weinsheimer said in a letter sent to Mueller that he should not speak about redacted material from his report, including material pertaining to pending criminal prosecutions, "uncharged third-parties" and "executive privilege," such as "presidential communications privileges," according to the Associated Press.

Mueller also reiterated through a spokesman that he plans to stay within the bounds of the 448-page report.

Here’s what to expect:

Mueller will be questioned about his findings on Trump’s possible obstruction of justice, which spans across 10 potential scenarios, according to Vox. This includes Trump’s involvement in then-FBI Director James Comey’s handling of the investigation, as well as Comey’s subsequent termination from his role.

Viewers of the hearing may see Mueller’s longtime aide, Aaron Zebley, as a witness, according to The New York Times. Mueller was the only witness listed for the hearing until Tuesday, when Mueller asked that his aide be sworn in.

Zebley’s position as a witness at the hearing has yet to be approved, and would shake things up for both Democrats and Republicans, who have already planned their questioning around Mueller being the sole witness.

Republicans sitting on the Judiciary and Intelligence Committees are likely prepared to address various anti-Trump texts sent between his team members, as well as anything that diminishes the damaging information about the President found in Mueller’s report, according to CNN.

Meanwhile, Democrats are likely prepared to focus on five major obstructions outlined in the Mueller Report – namely, his efforts in terminating Mueller’s role, and his tampering with witnesses, including campaign chairman Paul Manafort.
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 What to Expect From Robert Mueller's Wednesday Hearings
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Jacquie Cadorette

item.title: Bellatrix From Music to Margaritas, Maren Morris Is the Queen of Collaborations
item.description: It’s been a busy and empowering week for Maren Morris.
item.content:encoded:
You never know where Maren Morris is going to pop up next, but chances are it will be with some like-minded strong women. After spending 2018 in “The Middle”, Morris has been front and center with other powerful female performers for most of 2019.

Morris is currently on the road with GIRL: The World Tour. The all-female lineup is just the beginning though. Here are a few of the wonderful woman collaborations that the singer has been a part of over the past few weeks.

Miranda Lambert - “Too Pretty For Prison”

Last week, Miranda Lambert announced that she found the perfect person to jump on her new album. Morris will contributes to the track, “Too Pretty For Prison” on the latest from Lambert, due out later this year.

WATCH MORE: Our Favorite All-Female Duets

The Highwomen - “Redesigning Women”

Along with Brandi Carlile, Natalie Hemby, and Amanda Shires, Morris teams up for this role-redefining Americana anthem. The song is the first from The Highwomen's upcoming self-titled debut. In the video, the four make a pile out of outdated tropes like ironing boards and faddish exercise equipment, and extend an invite to an iconic collection of Country women. Lauren Alaina, Cam, Wynonna Judd, Cassadee Pope, Tanya Tucker, and more help set fire to the old ideas and kick off the beginning of The Highwomen.

Sheryl Crow – “Prove You Wrong”

Start with Sheryl Crow, add in the stomping swagger of Maren Morris, and top it off with the legendary Stevie Nicks. “Prove You Wrong” is a strutting slice of empowerment, executed effortlessly by three of the best in the game.

Kelsea Ballerini – Quality Therapy Session

After a whirlwind week of releases and a non-stop schedule of slaying, Morris stopped down in Nashville for a “quality therapy session” with “Miss Me More” singer Kelsea Ballerini. Sometimes a margarita and a good friend is all you need.

View this post on Instagram

quarterly therapy session with @kelseaballerini 😂

A post shared by Maren Morris (@marenmorris) on Jul 21, 2019 at 3:54pm PDT

Maren Morris returns this week to GIRL: The World Tour. You can find the full list of dates here.
item.subHeadline: The ‘GIRL’ singer is on a fierce female hot streak
item.seoHeadline: FREQ-1647 From Music to Margaritas Maren Morris a Collaborations Queen
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Michael Cerio
Joe Hyer
Jacquie Cadorette

item.title: Bellatrix Woman Fixes Wine-Stained Outfit with More Wine
item.description: See how this woman transformed her wine-stained outfit into a fashion statement.
item.content:encoded:
Don’t cry over spilled wine, just make a new outfit!

That’s exactly what Eleanor Walton did after red wine nearly ruined her all-white jumpsuit while at a horse race in England over the weekend.

Enlisting the help of her good friend Mia Williamson, the two quickly sprang into action by grabbing four more glasses of wine to further stain her clothes into a more cohesive look, according to People.

so we’re 2 hours into the races, and el comes and tells me someone has spilt red wine down her... no problem. Got some more red wine and fixed it and I think we’ve just made a new product to PLTs festival range pic.twitter.com/fXnJKYfNc2

— mia williamson (@MiaWiliamson_) July 20, 2019

The result was her soiled outfit morphed into a pink tie-dye getup that appeared downright fashionable.

“So we’re 2 hours into the races, and el comes and tells me someone has spilt red wine down her... no problem,” Williamson captioned a before and after side-by-side photo of Eleanor’s fashion mishap. “Got some more red wine and fixed it and I think we’ve just made a new product to PLTs festival range.”

PLT is short for PrettyLittleThing, the brand of the formerly white jumpsuit.

pretty little thing approval ...life complete x https://t.co/BUcSMsgoWd pic.twitter.com/rbOl1fF2XA

— eleanor walton🌙 (@eleanorwaltonn) July 21, 2019

Maintaining a positive attitude throughout the potentially day-ruining incident, Eleanor even shared a photo of herself trying to dry her stained outfit under a hand dryer in the bathroom. This is a ‘make it work’ moment!

Eventually the fashion brand caught wind of the wardrobe malfunction and retweeted Williamson’s images with the humorous caption, “Safe to say that wasn’t a ‘pour’ decision.”

Many folks online praised Eleanor’s inventiveness as one person commented, “This is brilliant.” Another added, “I actually can’t get over this. This is ART gals.”

But others were quick to point out the problem of being drenched in wine.

“So she just walking around with damp clothes. I hate that feeling I know it's sticking to her skin,” a concerned person tweeted. While another pointed out the obvious by sharing, “Just imagine the smell.”

Despite it all, Eleanor never let the situation get the best of her.

She added, “Part of me wanted to go home and change, but I was having too much fun and didn’t want to let a spill ruin my day.”

Spoken like a true legend!
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Woman Fixes Wine-Stained Outfit with More Wine
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Johnny Lopez

item.title: Bellatrix Watch Courteney Cox ‘Flip It & Reverse It’ in Epic Bikini Video
item.description: Watch Courteney Cox dive into her pool backwards in this epic Instagram video.
item.content:encoded:
A bikini is Courteney Cox’s best friend!

The 55-year-old actress beat the heat by showing off her amazing physique in a fun poolside video, reported the New York Post.

Rocking a black two-piece, Cox posted the clip in reverse to make it look like she was jumping out of the pool rather than into it.

View this post on Instagram

Oh so now I finally get what @missymisdemeanorelliott meant by put your thing down, flip it, and reverse it....only took me ten years.

A post shared by Courteney Cox (@courteneycoxofficial) on Jul 21, 2019 at 7:41pm PDT

As she emerges from the pool in the rewound video, Cox is seen putting on a black cover-up, throwing on sunglasses and taking a sip of her iced tea.

“Oh so now I finally get what @missymisdemeanorelliott meant by put your thing down, flip it and reverse it …. only took me ten years,” Cox captioned the post by referencing the lyrics in Missy Elliott’s 2002 hit “Work It.”

While the former "Friends" star credits her toned figure to workouts like Pilates, running and playing tennis, Cox previously revealed she gave up getting facial fillers because she could barely recognize herself.

“So now I just embrace who I am and getting older with what God gave me, not what I was trying to change,” she said.

“I think I am at a stage of my life where it’s very easy to be comfortable with who I am and who I’ve become and who I strive to be.”

It was just last month that Cox celebrated turning 55 by having a girls' night out with her former co-stars Jennifer Aniston and Lisa Kudrow.

The ladies and their male Must-See-TV counterparts – David Schwimmer, Matt LeBlanc and Matthew Perry – will have some more to celebrate as "Friends" turns 25 in a few weeks.

While a TV reunion is not currently in the works, fans will have to settle for some coffee and home furnishings.
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Watch Courteney Cox ‘Flip It & Reverse It’ in Bikini Video
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Johnny Lopez

item.title: Bellatrix The 1975 Take Over 'The Late Late Show'
item.description: The 1975 Take Over ‘The Late Late Show’
item.content:encoded:
The music sets on late night talk shows aren’t that big, but there’s usually just enough room for the performers to do what they need to do. Matty Healy of The 1975 had other ideas though during their appearance on “The Late Late Show.”

The unpredictable frontman, clad in a blue jumpsuit, spent about 30 seconds on-stage before he decided to stretch his legs. While singing the opening lines to “I Like America & America Likes Me,” Healy walked over to the main set and made himself comfortable in James Corden’s chair with a pair of backup dancers following.

Healy eventually made his way back to the stage, where he stood on top of the bass drum before the song quietly faded out to the cheers of the audience.

The 1975 had just appeared on The Late Late Show” in April, when Healy told Corden why the band was expecting to release two albums in less than a year.

“It’s not trying to be clever,” he said. “We’re artists, but we’re consumers primarily, of music and TV. And I always say we’re in that age now where you watch the best thing you’ve ever seen on Netflix and you’ll be like ‘That was the best thing I’ve ever seen.’ And then you just want the next thing immediately, and I’m like that with music as well. It just feels like I want to tour for the next two years and what do you want to do in a band? Do you want to affect culture? And I don’t think you can’t do that with one record now.”

The 1975 released their third studio album, A Brief Inquiry into Online Relationships, at the end of last year. The band started teasing album number four, Notes on a Conditional Form almost at the same time, but no release date has been announced. Google may have known at one point, however.
item.subHeadline: James Corden's stage could not contain Matty Healy
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 The 1975 Take Over 'The Late Late Show'
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Bob Diehl

item.title: Bellatrix K-Pop Stars NCT 127 Give an Inside Look at ‘Highway to Heaven’
item.description: K-pop chart-toppers NCT 127 stopped by RADIO.COM for an interview on their song “Highway to Heaven,” their favorite foods, and their favorite hobbies.
item.content:encoded:
NCT 127 is a K-pop band that’s topped charts with their flawless harmonies, infectious beats, and combination of languages. The offshoot of unlimited group NCT formed in 2017, and has been a fan favorite ever since.

“We’re really encouraging our fans to just take a break from all the stresses that you guys get from real life. And just really take the highway to heaven and do what you love,” NCT 127 tells RADIO.COM of their latest release. “Highway to Heaven” is an uplifting track from their NCT #127 WE ARE SUPERHUMAN mini album- and it just got an English version.

A vibrant new music video shows off the group’s choreographed dance moves in the canyons and deserts of the southwestern United States.

Along with giving us an inside look at their newest hit, they also made sure to tell us the most important thing about themselves: their favorite food. From In-N-Out to needing to try chicken and waffles, they definitely sparked all of our cravings. Hear about their favorite hobbies and American foods in the video below!
item.subHeadline: Plus get their favorite foods and hobbies
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 K-Pop Stars NCT 127 Give Inside Look at ‘Highway to Heaven’
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Tiana Timmerberg

item.title: Bellatrix Thomas Rhett and His Wife Are Expecting Their Third Child
item.description: Thomas Rhett and His Wife Are Expecting Their Third Child
item.content:encoded:
Thomas Rhett and his wife, Lauren Akins, are sharing some exciting news. The couple is expecting their third child.

“Excited to share that I will now be paying for 3 weddings,” the country star joked on Instagram. “I feel so blessed to say that our third child is on the way and it’s a girl!!”

The announcement is accompanied by a photo of the couple with their two young girls – all wearing bathing suits. Willa and Ada have their hands on mom’s baby bump. If you scroll through, you can also see the couple’s gender reveal that features a cloud of pink smoke.

View this post on Instagram

Excited to share that I will now be paying for 3 weddings😂 I feel so blessed to say that our third child is on the way and it’s a girl!! I love you so much @laur_akins. WG and AJ, y’all are gonna be the best big sisters! Bring on the crazy

A post shared by ThomasRhettAkins (@thomasrhettakins) on Jul 23, 2019 at 10:01am PDT

Lauren shared similar photos on her Instagram, saying their daughters can’t wait to meet their little sister. She added that she has been showing since she was only seven weeks pregnant.

“So it feels like we have been hiding this secret for an ETERNITY,” she wrote. “And I’d like to apologize to everyone I’ve canceled on, said no to or just been MIA, but for a second there I wasn’t sure if I was pregnant or just puked for a living. But she’s soooo worth it.”

View this post on Instagram

We decided we didn’t have enough princess dresses around the house so we’re adding another Akins baby girl to the family early next year 💕🎀😭💗💗💗 despite Thomas Rhett’s initial shock (swipe to see video 😂) we are absolutely over the moon for our baby girl! Our girls cannot wait to meet their little sister 💕💕 Willa Gray prays for her every night (heart in a puddle every time😭😭) & she and Ada James love to touch my belly and talk to her😭😭💗💗💗-especially bc I’ve been showing since I was SEVEN weeks (🤪). So it feels like we have been hiding this secret for an ETERNITY. And I’d like to apologize to everyone I’ve canceled on, said no to or just been MIA, but for a second there I wasn’t sure if I was pregnant or just puked for a living🤢. But she’s soooo worth it💕💗💕💗💕 We are SO excited! & if you need TR you can find him in the camping section at REI buying dude things.......jk, he’s excited too 🥰

A post shared by Lauren Akins (@laur_akins) on Jul 23, 2019 at 10:00am PDT

Thomas Rhett Takes Us Inside His New Album 'Center Point Road'
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Thomas Rhett and His Wife Are Expecting Their Third Child
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Bob Diehl

item.title: Bellatrix Exclusive: How Odell Beckham Jr. Has Embraced Trade from Giants to Browns
item.description: This is why Odell Beckham Jr. is seeing his much talked about trade from the New York Giants to the Cleveland Browns with fresh clarity and hope.
item.content:encoded:
(92.3 The Fan) -- Odell Beckham Jr. is cozying up to Cleveland.

The Cleveland Browns wide receiver joined Bull & Fox to talk about how he's embraced his controversial trade from the New York Giants to the Cleveland Browns.

Beckham told The Bull that he's struggled to get past prior controversies. "I think it's just a breath of fresh air," he said. "I haven't been perfect in the past, I know I've done things wrong. But I felt that I could never escape that, that I could never get past those moments. People only want to talk about the catch, or the stuff with Josh Norman. And it's like, how can a person ever grow if that's all that's ever brought back up and thrown back in your face?"

He even cited how people would box him in and make assumptions about him based on his unique haircut.

But now, the NFL star is coming to Cleveland with a revived clarity, seeing his move to the Browns as a fresh start that he's fully committed to.

"I'm happy to be here, be a part of all this," Beckham Jr. said. "I really want to give my all, my best, to this city, to this team, to this organization."

When asked about if his emotions make him a better player, he said: "It definitely does. There's also a time and a place where I've worked on it. But I think because of all the other frustrations I had... you also feel like you can't help your team win."

Beckham Jr. also discussed his relationship with Baker Mayfield and how he can help him going forward, his attitude toward the haters, and whether there's enough balls to go around in this offense.
item.subHeadline: It's just a breath of fresh air; it just feels good to be in a new place, a new start
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Exclusive: How OBJ Has Embraced Trade from Giants to Browns

item.title: Bellatrix Blink-182 Is Texting People a Sample of Their New Song 'Darkside'
item.description: Blink-182 wants your number so they can give you their new song, “Darkside”.
item.content:encoded:
Blink-182 wants your number.

On Tuesday the band began tweeting out a number, taken from a picture of a graffiti-covered bathroom stall. “For a good time text” is reads, along with the number (323) 831-0182.

👇🏼 +1 (323) 831-0182 👇🏼 pic.twitter.com/lXnAYX6oTO

— blink-182 (@blink182) July 23, 2019

If you’re willing to slide into blink’s SMS’ and give them a few details, the group will reward you with a sample of their song “Darkside.” The unreleased tune is the fourth sample from their upcoming album, following “Blame It On My Youth”, “Generational Divide”, and “Happy Days.”

Last week, blink-182 announced that the follow-up to their 2016 album California will finally arrive on September 20th.

WATCH MORE: Blink-182 Preview New Album And Tour with Lil Wayne

The band is currently on tour with Lil Wayne, who is totally really seriously excited to be there, celebrating the 20th anniversary of Enema Of The State.
You can find the full list of upcoming dates here.
item.subHeadline: The band’s new album arrives on September 20th
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Blink-182 Texting People Sample of Their New Song 'Darkside'
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Michael Cerio

item.title: Bellatrix Toddler Receives Birthday Cake Mistakenly Addressed to 'Loser'
item.description: A toddler, whose nickname is “Lizard,” received a birthday cake that read “Happy Birthday, Loser.”
item.content:encoded:
It’s your party and you can cry if you want to, especially when you get insulted on your birthday cake!

A Missouri mother got quite the surprise after picking up her toddler’s birthday cake and found the bakery had mistakenly written “Happy Birthday Loser” on it, according to People.

It all started when Melin Jones stopped into a local Walmart to get the festive treat for her two-year-old daughter Elizabeth and asked an employee to personalize it with her little girl’s unusual nickname, Lizard.

Edit to add that my child can not read , we didn’t tell her what it said , even if we did our 2 year old child wouldn’t...

Posted by Melin Jones on Sunday, June 30, 2019
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Toddler Gets Birthday Cake Mistakenly Addressed to 'Loser'
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Johnny Lopez

item.title: Bellatrix Vin Diesel Seen ‘Choking Back Tears’ After F&F9 Stunt Double Falls, Left in Coma
item.description: The ‘Fast & Furious 9’ star was emotional and shaken when his stunt double plunged 30 feet onto his head and fell into a coma.
item.content:encoded:
Vin Diesel was said to be “choking back tears” on the set of Fast & Furious 9 when his stunt double plunged 30 feet onto his head, the Daily Mail reports.

The stuntman, Joe Watts, was injured while shooting on set at the Warner Bros Studios in Leavesden, Hertfordshire in England.

Filming of the action franchise’s ninth installment halted when a safety cable snapped as Watts jumped off a balcony and hit the ground.

Watts fell into a coma following his serious head injury, according to his girlfriend Tilly Powell, also a stunt double herself. Powell and her father are currently attending Watts at his bedside in the hospital that he was airlifted to.

Powell said her “heart is shattered,” adding, “I love him so much. He has all his friends and family by his side to get him through this.”

Diesel was on set moments after the incident, reportedly emotional and shaken.

“Vin Diesel seen on set seconds after,” a source told The Sun Online. “He looked ashen, totally in shock and blinking back tears. He saw what happened.”

Watts is a British stuntman who performed on various major projects including Kingsman Golden Circle, Star Wars: The Last Jedi, Spider Man Far From Home, Game of Thrones and Jurassic World.

Activity on the set is quiet following the accident. One worker who was on set said, “It was very quiet there yesterday after it happened and it is the same today. I don’t think there is much going on.”
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Vin Diesel ‘Choking Back Tears’ When Stuntman Left in Coma
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Eldis Sula

item.title: Bellatrix Of Monsters and Men Take Us Inside 'Fever Dream'
item.description: Of Monsters and Men Take Us Inside ‘Fever Dream’
item.content:encoded:
It’s been four years since Of Monsters and Men released their second studio album Beneath the Skin, and when it was time to get back in the studio to craft a follow-up, the band from Iceland knew it.

“It was a natural development,” guitarist Ragnar “Raggi” Þórhallsson told RADIO.COM. “We had just been writing for a long time and we felt like we had enough.”

The results will be realized on Friday when Fever Dream is finally unveiled. Both Raggi and singer Nanna Brandis Hilmarsdóttir agree that the hard-charging “Alligator” is the track that holds the whole thing together.

“It came very early in the writing process,” Nanna explained. “It immediately just felt like something we wanted to explore because it was exciting. I guess that’s a lot of what we were searching for at that time, and we just wanted something new and exciting and it was challenging us.”

Raggi says Of Monsters and Men built on the vibe of “Alligator,” which is the lead single from Fever Dream and a RADIO.COM World Premiere, but that doesn’t mean the rest of the songs have a conscious theme.

“We weren’t too focused on bringing them too much together because that’s kind of what happens anyways, so if a song wanted to be something, we kind of went with it,” he said.

Of Monsters and Men, who are always willing to talk about their appearance on “Game of Thrones,” will begin a North American tour on August 2 in Los Angeles. The trek will stretch into the end of September in Vancouver, before they rest up for the European leg. Check out the full list of dates here.

Watch Of Monsters and Men Perform Live for the First Time in 3 Years
item.subHeadline: The band from Iceland is ready to release their first album in 4 years
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Of Monsters and Men Take Us Inside 'Fever Dream'
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Bob Diehl

item.title: Bellatrix John Oliver Confirms Beyoncé Was Photoshopped Into 'The Lion King' Cast Photo
item.description: In a recent appearance on ‘The Late Show with Stephen Colbert,’ John Oliver hilariously confirmed Beyoncé was Photoshopped into ‘The Lion King’ cast photo. Hear the amazing story behind it here
item.content:encoded:
The Lion King is already breaking box office records with one of the biggest film debuts in history. With nostalgia, incredibly realistic animation, and a star-studded cast, the Disney remake is unsurprisingly dominating.

Also unsurprisingly, Beyoncé is continuing to shine in the spotlight. Even when she wasn’t actually there.

When the cast photo for The Lion King was released earlier this month, everyone immediately noticed how Beyoncé’s poise and powerful energy stood out. So much so, that it seemed like she may have been edited into the picture. In a new appearance on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert, costar John Oliver confirmed she wasn’t really there for the group photo.

GET INTO THE CAST OF LION KING! 🦁 pic.twitter.com/9mJTtEWMfg

— MEFeater Magazine (@mefeater) July 8, 2019

A roaring crowd welcomed John to the stage as he confidently announced that he’s now a “gigantic movie star,” and a Disney princess. During his skyrocket to fame, he got to meet one of the most famous people in history… kind of.

“People are speculating she was photoshopped in- and you’re right next to her. Can you tell us whether she was there?” Stephen asked while showing John a picture of the cast photo and pointing to Beyoncé.

“Yeah, she wasn’t there,” John immediately confirmed. “Chiwetel was sitting in the front and he said, ‘You need to be careful where your foot is.’ I looked down and there was just this piece of tape on the floor with Beyoncé’s name written on it,” he recalled while reenacting his quick jump away from Beyoncé’s spot.

“If you look at my face in there, I look really intimidated... It’s only appropriate that there’s a significant gap between me and the actual queen.”

Watch his hilarious confession in the video above!
item.subHeadline: Hear the hilarious story behind it
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Beyonce Was Photoshopped Into 'The Lion King' Cast Photo
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Tiana Timmerberg

item.title: Bellatrix Chance the Rapper Forced to Eat Broccoli After Losing a Bet with Megan Thee Stallion
item.description: Chance The Rapper drops his debut ‘The Big Day’ on Friday.
item.content:encoded:
A lot has gone into Chance The Rapper’s debut album. Years of sweat and success, and at least one piece of broccoli.

Chance is apparently not big into vegetables, so when he challenged Megan Thee Stallion to get a verse done in time for his debut, the Fever rapper bet him some broccoli she could turn it around in time.

“Okay y’all this is RARE FOOTAGE” she wrote on Instagram. “Chance The Rapper does NOT eat vegetables right, and I’ve been on the road so much that I haven’t been able to record a lot rn. I bet him that if I had my verse to him In the amount of time he needed it by he would have to eat broccoli.”

“We see who won” she added, with the video of Chance battling through a single piece of broccoli.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Hot Girl Meg (@theestallion) on Jul 21, 2019 at 3:34pm PDT

We will find out on Friday if Megan Thee Stallion is featured on The Big Day.
After three career-shaping mixtapes and three GRAMMY awards, Chance will finally release a debut album on July 26.

The 26-year-old star revealed the title and release date last week during a visit to The Tonight Show starring Jimmy Fallon.

You can find more details about The Big Day here.
item.subHeadline: ‘The Big Day’ arrives this Friday July 26
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Chance the Rapper Forced To Eat Broccoli After Losing a Bet
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Michael Cerio

item.title: Bellatrix Ariana Grande, Taylor Swift, and All the Nominations for the 2019 MTV Video Music Awards
item.description: See all the nominees for the 2019 MTV Video Music Awards, including the “Best K-pop” category for the first time ever.
item.content:encoded:
Taylor Swift and Ariana Grande lead all nominees for the 2019 MTV VMAs, both collecting 10 nominations for this year’s edition of the award show.

“You Need To Calm Down” and “thank u, next” will face off in the Video Of The Year category against clips courtesy of Billie Eilish, Lil Nas X, 21 Savage, and the Jonas Brothers.

Video Of The Year is usually the biggest award of the night, but this year it might be bested by the continuing K-pop invasion. For the first time ever, the show will hand out a “moon person” in the Best K-pop category, with BTS and Halsey’s “Boy With Luv” facing strong competition from BLACKPINK, Monsta X, TOMORROW X TOGETHER, NCT 127, and EXO.

This year also marks the debut of the Video For Good category, showcasing clips that hope to inspire social change. It includes nominations for The Killers, John Legend, and Lil Dicky.

WATCH MORE: Lil Dicky Goes Behind the Video for 'Earth'

Also look for a big night from Lil Nas X and Billie Eilish, with both artists up for multiple awards throughout the show.

Voting opens Tuesday July 23 on MTV’s website, and runs through August 15. This year’s VMAs is hosted by comedian Sebastian Maniscalo, taking place at the Prudential Center in Newark, NJ.

You can watch the 2019 MTV Video Music Awards live on Monday August 26 on MTV.

Below is the full list of nominees.

VIDEO OF THE YEAR

21 Savage ft. J. Cole – "a lot"

Billie Eilish – "Bad Guy"

Ariana Grande – "thank u, next"

Jonas Brothers – "Sucker"

Lil Nas X ft. Billy Ray Cyrus – "Old Town Road (Remix)"

Taylor Swift – "You Need to Calm Down"

ARTIST OF THE YEAR

Cardi B

Billie Eilish

Ariana Grande

Halsey

Jonas Brothers

Shawn Mendes

SONG OF THE YEAR

Drake – "In My Feelings"

Ariana Grande – "thank u, next"

Jonas Brothers – "Sucker"

Lady Gaga & Bradley Cooper – "Shallow"

Lil Nas X ft. Billy Ray Cyrus – "Old Town Road (Remix)"

Taylor Swift – "You Need to Calm Down"

BEST NEW ARTIST

Ava Max

Billie Eilish

item.title: Bellatrix Boxer Maxim Dadashev Dies from Brain Injuries Sustained in Ring
item.description: Russian-born lightweight Maxim Dadashev died after injuries he received during a fight on Friday sent him to the hospital.
item.content:encoded:
(106.7 The Fan) -- Boxer Maxim Dadashev has died from injuries during a fight Friday at MGM National Harbor, according to ESPN. He was 28.

The Russian-born lightweight – 13-0 coming into the bout with Subriel Matias – sustained repeated blows to the head during the fight, so many that his trainer, Buddy McGirt, stopped the fight after the 11th round.

This is a mark of a great trainer, one that knows his warrior at war 🥊 a trainer has to love his fighter enough to make a crucial call sometimes saving him from his very self. Great call Buddy @buddymcgirtboxing prayers up for this young warrior #speedyrecovery #toughsport 🙏🏾 pic.twitter.com/cKljvTKOgt

— The Magic Man 🎩 (@AntonioTarver) July 20, 2019

After the fight, Dadashev was rushed to UM Prince George's Hospital Center, where doctors performed a two-hour surgery to relieve a subdural hematoma, or bleeding of the brain, according to ESPN. Dadashev was placed in a medically induced coma after the operation.

Per ESPN, early Saturday morning Dadashev's manager was informed the boxer had been showing signs of severe brain damage.

RIP Maxim Dadashev.

He passed away from injuries suffered during Friday's fight, according to trainer Buddy McGirt and Donatas Janusevicius, Dadashev's strength and conditioning coach.

We join Maxim’s family and friends in grief, support and wish prompt resignation.

Via @espn pic.twitter.com/8Pbu6cD6LC

— World Boxing Council (@WBCBoxing) July 23, 2019

Follow 106.7 The Fan on Twitter and Instagram
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Boxer Dadashev Dies from Brain Injuries Sustained in Ring

item.title: Bellatrix Fans Fuming at Harry and Meghan’s Birthday Note to Prince George
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex caught some major flack from royal devotees for their simple message to royal nephew.
item.content:encoded:
They really don’t make it easy to be a royal!

Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are under fire from internet-dwelling royal devotees for the comments they left on photos celebrating Prince George’s 6th birthday.

The photos were posted on Sunday by the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge on the Kensington Palace Instagram account.

Under one of the pics, Uncle Harry and Aunt Meghan commented, “Happy Birthday,” from their @SussexRoyal account, adding, “Wishing you a very special day and lots of love!”

View this post on Instagram

🎂 Happy Birthday Prince George! The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are very pleased to share new photographs of Prince George to mark His Royal Highness's sixth birthday. This photograph was taken on holiday with the family by The Duchess of Cambridge. Thank you everyone for all your lovely messages!

A post shared by Kensington Palace (@kensingtonroyal) on Jul 21, 2019 at 2:32pm PDT

Well that doesn’t seem so bad! But royal fans disagreed, with Instagrammers coming out the woodwork to hiss that the comment was too informal and not worthy of the future king.

“He is the future KING. Treat him with respect,” one commenter humphed emphatically. “He is HRH!!!!!!!!!” (Shorthand for His Royal Highness.)

“He is HRH Prince George to you!!!!” another user wrote. “Don’t forget to mention!”

Other users were more lax about the formalities, defending Harry and Meghan.

“They are his uncle and aunt,” wrote one commenter. “No need to write his title. Being sincere is more important.”

Others shared in the Don’t Be So Formal Bro sentiment. Another user wrote, “Stop nitpicking relax. You just want to find fault where there is none. Family is family and how they address each other in public or private is none of your concern.”

The criticism is nothing new, especially for Meghan Markle, who caught flack recently for wanting to watch some tennis in peace.

But it’s not hard to cause rumblings and rattle some cages when you’re a member of that other most regal court -- the Most Influential People on the Internet -- with the likes of Lil Nas X, Cardi, and Ariana.
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Fans Livid at Harry, Meghan’s Birthday Note to Prince George
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Eldis Sula

item.title: Bellatrix Watch Shaq Own the Mosh Pit at a European Festival
item.description: Watch Shaq Own the Mosh Pit at a European Festival
item.content:encoded:
Watch out! There’s a man coming through who eclipses 7 feet and 300 pounds.

Shaquille O’Neal was impossible to miss when he took over the mosh pit at a European EDM festival. The former NBA star seemed to be having the time of his life as he joined the crowd at Tomorrowland in Belgium. From the looks of it, Shaq actually held back a little, most likely to avoid pancaking those who were half his size.

View this post on Instagram

Sometimes is better to party WITH the people, than for the people ! @tomorrowland

A post shared by DJ DIESEL (@djdiesel) on Jul 19, 2019 at 1:37pm PDT

Cell phones were out capturing the moment that was surely a highlight of the afternoon for festival-goers. One of the clips made its way to Shaq’s Instagram where he captioned it: “Sometimes is better to party WITH the people, than for the people !”

As Shaq alluded to, he didn’t just happen to be at the festival. The 47-year-old played a set under his alias DJ Diesel. It’s been a passion of his since he was kid.

View this post on Instagram

I just Rocked @tomorrowland

A post shared by DJ DIESEL (@djdiesel) on Jul 19, 2019 at 1:38pm PDT
item.subHeadline: The former NBA star also played a set of his own
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 Watch Shaq Own the Mosh Pit at a European Festival
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Bob Diehl

item.title: Bellatrix On Tour: John Mayer Debuts Improvised Ode to the Fan That Yells ‘Play Free Bird’
item.description: At his summer tour date in Philadelphia, PA, John Mayer filled the Wells Fargo Center with incredible musicianship and lots of laughs. Two fulls sets made for a 2 and 1/2 hour setlist, and left time for an improvised “Free Bird” jam.
item.content:encoded:
“Thank you all for allowing me to be a part of your well-balanced breakfast,” John Mayer told a packed crowd of 19,000 fans. The singer-songwriter praised the younger generation for their eclectic mix of interests. From nostalgia to the cutting edge, their open-minded tastes are even more diverse than the crowd of people that came together to prove a shared love of John Mayer is seemingly the only thing that unites everyone.

John Mayer is currently trekking the country on his summer tour. With no opening act, John is allowed the time and freedom to explore his entire catalog: seven studio albums, two decades of music, and a slew of hits you forgot were even his. Two and a half hours of nostalgia, deep cuts, and instant classics is spread throughout two sets that spotlight brilliant musicianship.

John effortlessly weaves through a setlist that, according to Setlist.fm, has been wildly different on the past three nights of tour. Even with notably improvised sections and an unpredictable rotation of songs, the “No Such Thing” singer and his full band alike are polished and well-rehearsed. John dives into solo after solo in the middle of songs like “Helpless” and “Rosie,” showing off his guitar skills before giving a subtle nod to his band to indicate that his tangent is over. They seamlessly resume the recorded version of the song.

A huge personality and unmatched wittiness haven’t been allowed to outshine the fact that, at his core, John Mayer is an amazing artist. Even playful moments like an improvised ode to that one guy that feels the need to yell “Free Bird” between every song still highlight how he’s able to whip a song out of nowhere. And the fact that he’s damn funny.

“Every concert’s got the ‘Free Bird’ guy, and I don’t know why he yells it,” he sings in the brand new and likely never-to-be-heard-again “Free Bird Guy” song. “He gets a seat and he clears his throat, takes out the note he wrote and he yells it. And all it says is, ‘Hey guy, don’t forget to yell ‘Free Bird’ real loud in between the songs. Maybe he’ll hear you, maybe he’ll make a song of his own.”

“Free Bird Guy” - a Philly original from r/JohnMayer

While fans that attend remaining dates of his tour may not get to hear “Free Bird Guy,” they will get to zone out to timeless jams like “Stop This Train” and “Slow Dancing In a Burning Room.” Tracks from longtime favorites Continuum and Room For Squares are balanced by newer songs, that of course include the meme-worthy “New Light.” An encore after hours of Mayer concludes the night with a brief reenactment of the poorly green screened video.

“I’m John Mayer, and I’m ready to be a star!” a clip of the iconic video announces to conclude the night. Two full sets presents something for everyone, and overheard murmurs had dozens of attendees reeling from the fact that “all of their favorite songs” were played. Even the most casual listeners found themselves captivated for the full show, and the stadium stayed packed all the way through the encore. Click here for the remaining tour dates.
item.subHeadline: Why even the most casual listeners need to see him live
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 On Tour: John Mayer Debuts Improvised ‘Free Bird Guy’ Song
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Tiana Timmerberg

item.title: Bellatrix The Title of Track 5 from Taylor Swift's 'Lover' Appears to Leak Before She Can Announce It
item.description: Did we just learn the name of the next Taylor Swift song?
item.content:encoded:
On Monday, Taylor Swift set a date for some news she is “reeeeeally excited” to share.

The singer posted a clip of the Number 5 bullseye from her “You Need To Calm Down” video, calling the image an easter egg and promising to reveal the details during an Instagram Live at 5 PM EST on Tuesday afternoon.

View this post on Instagram

I’m going live tomorrow, July 23 at 5pm ET! I have some stuff I’m reeeeeally excited to tell you about, including some info on this Easter egg right here. 🏹🎯👀⬆️

A post shared by Taylor Swift (@taylorswift) on Jul 22, 2019 at 7:59am PDT

Immediately Swifties sprung into detective mode, piecing together the clues. But before they could completely unravel the mystery themselves, it appears Apple Music might have done it for them.

On Tuesday morning, the site revealed that Track 5 on Swift’s upcoming album, Lover, is called “The Archer”, which makes sense given the image in question. However, as with all things Taylor Swift, answers sometimes only ask more questions.

In the video, Hayley Kiyoko is the one firing the shot at the number 5. Will the singer and friend be featured on the upcoming track? Other sources also claim that Jack Antonoff is credited on the song, which would be the first of the Lover era for the long-time collaborator. The song is only one of three that has been revealed on the site so far, along with previous singles “ME!” and “You Need To Calm Down.”

As Swifties know, the 5th song on a Taylor Swift album is usually a deep and emotional affair, so this could be key to what Lover is all about.

Lover is the seventh studio album from Taylor Swift and it arrives on August 23rd. The 18-track album she describes as "very romantic", will also be available in four different deluxe editions at Target.

WATCH MORE: From Kendrick Lamar to Ed Sheeran: Taylor Swift's Biggest Artist Collaborations
item.subHeadline: Has the next song from Swift's upcoming album been revealed?
item.seoHeadline: QA1.64 The Title of Track 5 from Taylor Swift's 'Lover' Leaked?
item.dc:creator: Joe Hyer
Michael Cerio
